connectorUiConfig.title: Azure DevOps Auditing
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The Azure DevOps Auditing data connector provides the capability to ingest Azure DevOps events with Azure Sentinel. It helps you gain visibility into what is happening in your environment, such as who is connected, which applications are installed and running, and much more.

sampleQueries.query:
AzureDevOpsAuditing
 | summarize count() by ActorDisplayName
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: AzureDevOpsAuditing
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
AzureDevOpsAuditing
 | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
 | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
AzureDevOpsAuditing
 | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
 | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(7d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permission are required.
role assignment permissions are required for option 2.

customs.name: Azure DevOps pattoken
customs.description: A personal access token (PAT) is used as an alternate password to authenticate into Azure DevOps. [See the documentation to learn more about Pat Tokens](https://aka.ms/pattoken).

instructionSteps.description:
>**NOTE:** To setup the connection to Microsoft Sentinel a personal access token (PAT) is required.
>By default, Project Collection Administrators (PCAs) are the only group that have access to the auditing feature.
You must have the following permissions:
- Manage Audit Streams

instructionSteps.title: Option 1 - PowerShell
instructionSteps.description:
Use this method for automated configuration of the log forwarding using a PowerShell Script.
1. Replace the _*{organization}*_ with the Azure DevOps organization name.
2. Replace the _*{pattoken}*_ with the Personal Access Token.
